alert.note: Alert for Escambia; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 11:46AM EDT until May 26 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Alabama, including the following county, Escambia. portions of northwest Florida, including the following counties, Escambia and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1046 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brewton, Century, Flomaton, East Brewton, Jay, Pollard, Riverview, Bratt, Bluff Springs, Brownsdale, McDavid, Byrneville, South Flomaton, Chumuckla Springs, Wahl, New York, Welka, Pine Barren, Cobbtown and Osaka. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
